Abstract: The simulation of complex biomolecular systems, particularly the ribosome, presents a significant challenge in computational biology. This study leverages advanced computer simulations and molecular dynamics (MD) to explore the intricate mechanisms of ribosome function, including translation and the interaction with antibiotics. By integrating data from cryogenic electron microscopy (cryo-EM), we aim to enhance the accuracy of our simulations, providing a detailed understanding of the ribosome's structural dynamics at an atomic level. Our approach not only sheds light on the fundamental processes of protein synthesis but also offers insights into the molecular basis of antibiotic resistance, paving the way for the development of novel therapeutic strategies. This research underscores the importance of combining computational and experimental techniques to unravel the complexities of biomolecular systems.
